thesis.description: The experimental work in connection with this thesis was carried on under the direction of Dr.R.L. Conklin of the Animal Pathology department,Macdonald College, and was done in connection with the studies on bovine genital diseases. The importance of genital disease as an economic factor has long been recognized. There is developing gradually a clearer conception of the diseases of cattle which interfere primarily with the normal processes of reproduction. History relates many reasons which explain the early death of the fetus and its expulsion from the uterus. [...]
thesis.creator: Thompson, Robert R.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
thesis.title: The bacterial flora of the pregnant bovineuterus.

thesis.description: The problem of solubility and the phenomena connected therewith lies at the basis of chemistry. Notwithstanding its importance, however, it cannot be said that the question has been fully elucidated. The work of van't Hoff and succeeding investigators has resulted in a more satisfactory understanding of the problem, so far as liquids are concerned, than was hitherto possessed, but the question of solid solutions is still to a large extent unanswered. [...]
thesis.creator: Toole, Francis James.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The absorption of gases by metals.

thesis.description: Notwithstanding the fact that the working of lead and zinc replacement deposits in limestone -- where there is no apparent connection with igneous activity -- can be traced back to the beginning of historical times, the literature on the subject does not show that any investigations of the limestones in which such deposits occur have been undertaken to find out whether they have had any definite influence on the mineralization found in them. In the present investigation it has been the writer's aim to discover, if possible, what part the limestones have played, so as to try and explain why one bed of limestone is mineral-bearing and another is barren of such mineralization; and determine whether this selectivity in replacement is due to the character of the replaced rock, e.g.whether the purest limestone beds have been most easily replaced or vice versa. [...]
thesis.creator: Gerson, Harold Samuel.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Investigation of lead-zinc replacements in limestones where there is no apparent connection with igneous activity.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is beyond doubt that no amount of theorizing can wipe away the basic differences in point of view that are to be found in the realm of industrial activity. The business man, as atrained co-ordinator of economic activity, regards it as his proper policy to reduce costs of production to a minimum. One of these costs is the labour cost. There is no reason evident to the business man that should prevent him from applying the same skill in determining wage rates as in buying material supplies. Hence he attempts to secure labour as cheaply as possible. He devotes as little as possible to the item of wages. This the competitive system demands. The workman, on the other hand, has as his essential endeavour the attempt to secure as high wages as possible. [...]
thesis.creator: Gruchy, Allan G.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: Collective bargaining in the building, coalminingand transportation industries of Canada.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Seed treatment, as here considered, is the disinfection of seed by means of chemicals used as liquids or in the form of a dust, prior to seeding, so that the seed and young plant is protected from the attacks of pathogenic organisms which may be present on the seed or in the surrounding soil; for such a treatment to be of value it must not, at the same time, injure the seed to the extent of preventing it from developing into a mature plant. It has been known for many years that seeds of nearly all plants are capable of carrying on their exterior the spores of pathogenic as well as harmless organisms. From the survey of the history of plant pathology, one can obtain sufficient data to realize that the economic importance of seed treatment has not been fully realized until very recently. [...]
thesis.creator: Godbout, Fernand Louis.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: A study of seed treatment.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the fourth decade of the last century the British Provinces in North Amerioa were granted responsible government. With the passing of the control of the public purse to the elected Assemblies, there was adopted a budgetary system analagous to that of Great Britain. The system was continued after Confederation both by the new Dominion Government and by the provinces. lhe Minister of Finance presents an annual Budget to the House of Commons, and, in the course of his statement, reviews the financial results of the past fiscal year, presents estimates for the remainder of the current year and for the year just commencing, and announces his proposals for an increase or decrease in taxation, or for other changes in financial administration, which Parliament is to consider. [...]
thesis.creator: Goldenberg, Hyman C.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: The Canadian budgets (1867-1928).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: I should 1ike to make it clear, at the very outset of this thesis, that my essay is, in no way, an attempt to prove any final formula for the interpretation of Browning'sphilosophy. An essay of this type cannot hope to uphold any definite theory. It can only try to offer a few suggestions reached by a crttical study of the poet, himself, and his contribution to the literature of his time. At once a great thinker, a man of great originality and of great erudition. Browning is a poet of whom it would be impossible to say dogmatically how much of his philosophy is to be attributed to his own erudition and how much to his powers of original thinking. [...]
thesis.creator: MacKay, Robert de Wolfe.
thesis.subject: Browning, Robert, 1812-1889 -- Philosophy.
English.
thesis.title: The philosophy and poetry of Robert Browning : with special reference to his philosophy of immortality, its sources and some conclusions.

As an accompaniment to this solemn act, CaptainSchering of the German ship "Elizabeth" caused the following proclamation to be read: "His Majesty the German Emperor, William the First, King of Prussia, has commanded me to go with his corvette Elizabeth to Angra Pequena, to place the territory belonging to Herr Luderitz on the west coast of Africa under the direct protection of His Majesty. [...]

thesis.description: Hydrogen peroxide was first described by L. J. Thénard in 1818 in a paper entitled "Observations sur la combinaisona nouvellee entre l'oxygène et divers acides." He made weak solutions of hydrogen peroxide by acting on barium peroxide with various acids and proved that it was a super-oxide of hydrogen. This method of Thénard's, the neutralization of an acid by a peroxide or an alkali or an alkaline earth, has remained to this day the most convenient way of manufacturing it. [...]

thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Properties of hydrogen peroxide.

thesis.description: The asbestos industry in Canada, within the past few years especially, has required consideration by the economist. Engaged in the production of a mineral with great economic utility, it has shown that its prosperity has not been adequate. It is almost an asiom that Canada possesses a "monopoly" of the world's asbestos. The use of this commodity is wide-spread; while cognizance of its valuable properties is universal. [...]

Asbestos.

thesis.description: This thesis considers Presbyterian settlers, laity and clergy, who were living in western Lower Canada between 1815 and 1842. It emphasizes their national origins and the areas in which they settled. What Presbyterian chucrches were built and what ministers served them are treated in some detail. Because various branches of the Presbyterian Church took root in Canada at that time, and endeavour is made to note the changing relationship of a Canadian branch to its mother church in Scotland or the United States and to observe the interrelationship of one branch to another in Canada. Denominational structures, Presbyteries and Synods are touched on briefly. Finally, the part played by the Glasgow Colonial Society and the American Home Missionary Society in securing ministers for Canada is outlined.
thesis.creator: McDougall, Elizabeth Ann
thesis.subject: Presbyterian Church -- Québec (Province) -- History.
History.
thesis.title: The Presbyterian Church in Western Lower Canada, 1815-1842
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: James McGIll was born on October 6, 1744, in the City of Glasgow, the eldest son of James McGill and his wife Margaret Gibson (1). Though the name is sufficiently known in Scotlandthrough the services of outstanding men (2) who have borne it, it is difficult to establish a possible connection between them and the founder of the University. There was of course in his time no compulsory registration of births which renders unsatisfactory any attempt to trace his lineage (3). [...]

thesis.description: The research work described in this thesis involved three distinct experimental problems; the preparation of pure hydrogen peroxide, the measurement of the dielectric constant of ethereal solutions of hydrogen peroxide and an investigation of the accuracy of the resonance method when used for the measurement of the dielectric constant of slightly conducting solutions. The densities of the different ethereal solutions were required and also the dielectric constants of the three component system, ether, water and hydrogen peroxide were measured and compared with the dielectric constant of hydrogen peroxide in ether. [...]

thesis.description: The relation of the Cyclic acetals towards the carbohydrates, anhydro sugars and polysaccharides, has·been repeatedly pointed out by Hibbert and co-workers. This connection is clearly seen from a comparison of the following structures: [...] It is evident that a close connection exists between the open chain half-acetals(V) and products such as a-methyl glucoside (VI). On the other hand cyclic acetals from glycerol (I) or from glycol (III) have much in common with anhydrous sugars (IV) and also with polysaccharides (II). This is evident from the characteristic grouping within the dotted lines. [...]

thesis.description: Les manuscrits Lynar représentent une des collections plus vastes de musiqued‘orgue d‘Allemagne du Nord. La collection Lynar B3 comprend un nombreconsidérable d‘oeuvres anonymes qui ne furent jamais publiées. Cette étudeconstitue donc la première publication d‘une transcription de cette tabulaturehistorique en notation moderne de tous les praeludia/praeambula anonymes dufascicule Lynar B3. En outre, l‘étude replace ces pièces dans l‘histoire dupraeambulum d‘Allemagne du Nord dans une perspective synoptique du rôle de lamusique d‘orgue à l‘intérieur de la messe luthérienne, de celui de l‘improvisation,de l‘influence de la fantasia sur le praeludium, du système de tabulature, et del‘histoire et du contenu du manuscrit Lynar B3 même. Cette étude propose uncatalogue thématique des incipits de toutes les pièces avec informations sur lesdurées, les tonalités, et les considérations formelles. Si la collection ne dénote pasune qualité uniformement élevée comparable à l‘oeuvre de Sweelinck ou celled‘autres éminents compositeurs, elle offre néanmoins un aperçu très stimulant del‘atelier d‘un organiste du XVIIème siècle, et ajoute à notre compréhension d‘uneressource historique significative.

The Lynar manuscripts represent one of the largest collections of North Germanorgan music. The Lynar B collection includes a sizeable number of anonymousworks that have never been published. This study thus constitutes the firstpublication of a transcription from the historical tablature into modern notation ofall the anonymous præludia/præambula from the Lynar B3 fascicle. Furthermore,the study situates these pieces within the history of the North German præambulumby way of a systematic survey into the function of organ music in the Lutheran massand the role of improvisation, the influence of the fantasia on the præludium, thetablature system, and the history and content of the Lynar B3 manuscript itself.This study offers a thematic catalogue of the incipits of the pieces with informationon their length, tonality, and formal outline. The collection is not of uniformly highquality comparable with the oeuvre of Sweelinck or other major composers, butprovides a highly stimulating insight into the workshop of a seventeenth-centuryorganist, and completes our understanding of a major historical resource.
thesis.creator: Dierks, Michael
thesis.subject: Organ Music.
Music.
thesis.title: The untouched organ works of the Lynar B3 tablature and their context in the history of the North German Præambulum
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: J'ai découvert le nom de Georg Friedrich Kauffmann (1679-1735) lors de mes études doctorales à l'université McGill. Plusieurs de mes lectures mentionnaient son nom en précisant que ce compositeur était à l'origine de la plus abondante source de registrations détaillées pour des oeuvres pour orgue de l'époque baroque. Cependant, en m‟intéressant de plus près à Kauffmann, je me suis aperçu qu'il n'existait que très peu d'études approfondies sur les registrations de ce compositeur. En lisant la thèse doctorale de Theodore van Wyk, publiée en 2005 et ainsi au faîte de la recherche sur Kauffmann, j'ai réalisé qu'une question était régulièrement absente de tous ces travaux musicologiques: pourquoi Kauffmann a-t-il indiqué telles registrations dans tels préludes? En discutant avec le musicologue Bruce Haynes, qui termine actuellement la rédaction de son livre The Pathetick Musician, dans lequel il étudie entre autres les Passions dans les cantates de Johann Sebastian Bach, la réponse à cette question s'est imposée d'elle-même. Il doit certainement exister un lien entre les registrations de Kauffmann et les textes des chorals sur lesquels il a composé ses préludes! En effet, les préludes de Kauffmann sont composés sur des mélodies de chorals luthériens, si bien que le texte de ces chorals est implicite à ces préludes pour orgue seul et apparaît en filigrane. [...]
thesis.creator: Kunz, Jean-Willy
thesis.subject: Organ Music.
Music.
thesis.title: Les registrations dans le recueil de préludes de chorals pour orgue de Georg Friedrich Kauffmann Harmonische Seelenlust
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The investigation of the secretory function of the pancreas in the rabbit has interest from different points of view. It is not only interesting from a purely comparative physiological aspect, but the peculiarities of the function of the alimentary tract of the rabbit provide an opportunity to approach the study of the mechanism of pancreatic secretion from a new point of view. The great difference between the pancreatic secretion in herbivorous animals such as the rabbit and that of carnivorous animals such as the dog and cat, is that the secretion in the herbivors is continuous. This continuity of secretion was assumed by early investigators to be dependent on the unceasing digestive work of the stomach. In carnivors the stomach functions only for a few hours after a meal whereas in herbivorous animals the stomach ts always more or less full. [...]
thesis.creator: Baxter, Stewart G.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: The nervous control of the pancreatic gland in the rabbit.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Although the secretory effect of the cervical sympathetic nerve on the submaxillary gland of the dog was established almost seventy-five years ago by Czermak, at the present time its functional relationship is still indefinitely defined. There is no doubt that the peculiar action of the sympathetic nerve made investigation of its function difficult and led to the formulation of several hypotheses to explain its action on the secretory apparatus of the salivary glands. The sympathetic nerve is the second secretory nerve supplying the salivary glands, and when it is sectioned there is very little change in the reflex salivary secretion. After section of the parasympathetic nerve supply, the sympathetic nervealone cannot transmit reflex impulses from the mouth cavity to the salivary glands. [...]
thesis.creator: Baxter, Hamilton A.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: The nervous control of the salivary secretion.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: At the time of Confederation the original provinces of Canada were separated from tbe isolated oolony of British Columbia on the Pacific coast by a vast hinterland some two thousand miles in length. This region oontained little more than a mere handfu1 of inhabitants and was feeb1y administered by the Hudson's Bay Company. Clearly, if British North Americawas to be consolidated from east to west, some visibly effective governments wbose authority oould readily be recognized and enforced was needed in this territory to provide for its settlement and development. Consequent1y, in the British North America Act of 1867, prevision was made for its admission into the Union. [...]

thesis.description: The circulation of alkali reagents into and of reaction products out of the fibre cavity, a subdivision of the large field of wood penetration by various reagents, was investigated by alkali sorption measurements. In this research the investigation of the sorption of sodium hydroxide by spruce wood from solutions of up to ten percent hydroxide at twenty degrees centigrade was planned. It was hoped, too, that the effect of previously treating the samples by sodium hydroxide solutions an elevated temperatures might be determined. [...]

thesis.description: With the object of aiding geophysical investigation, three new methods have been developed theoretically for determining the Dielectric Constant of Rock from the core rods obtained in diamond drill boring. In all cases the necessity of mechanically shaping the specimens to be tested is obviated. Apparatus has been oonstructed and a oonsiderable amount of experimental work has been done on one of these --- the Immersion Method --. but so far with inconclusive results. This is ascribed largely to the delicacy of the capacity measurements involved. [...]

thesis.description: The question as to whether a sense of hearing is or is not present in fishes has been the subject of considerable discussion and numerous experiments. From time to time various workers have succeeded in proving to their own satisfaction that this or that species of fish can hear, only to be confronted subsequently with negative evidence to all appearances equally convincing. It was only by means of the most carefully controlled experiments that our present knowledge of the subject was acquired. [...]

thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Experiments on the sense of hearing in fishes.

thesis.description: A perusal of this thesis reveals meagre references to printed material and a very scanty bibliography. The absence of this information is not due in any way to lack of research work on the part of the writer, but arises primarily from the newness of the cellophane industry. The comparatively recent establishment of the industry largely accounts for the lack of literature dealing with it. Furthermore, a large number of patents originally covering the process of manufacturing cellophane has expired, thereby exposing the DuPont cellophane company in the United states and the cellophane subsidiary of Canadian Industries Limited in Canada to merciless competition on the part of outsiders. [...]
thesis.creator: McIntyre, George Douglas
thesis.subject: Cellulose industry -- Canada.

thesis.title: The cellophane industry in Canada and its relations to allied and inter-related industries.

thesis.description: Steel is the basic material in the production of the entire mechanism of modern industry and transportation. Steel has been called the "core of capitalism". The very word is fraughtwith romance. It is the symbol of strength. The ramifications of its production include the ownership of mineral deposits, of coal mines, of huge plants - an integrated whole. The stress and conflict of the present economic era are reflected in the growth of the steel industry. The competitive system generated the desire and necessity of control, and in this process the introduction of huge amounts of capital followed. It was this necessity that led to the trust movement that involved the steel industry. [...]
thesis.creator: McCracken, Edward J.
thesis.subject: Economics.
Steel industry and trade -- Nova Scotia.
thesis.title: The steel industry of Nova Scotia.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the Kane System or Composite Construction, rolled steel sections are replaced by welded, open web trusses which are haunched in concrete in the usual way. The concrete haunch, however, is figured to take stress. The trusses are strong enough in their unhaunched condition to resist the construction load or the wet concrete, and their material is so placed that it combines with the concrete in exactly the same way as does ordinary reinforcing to resist the superimposed load which comes on the frame after the concrete has set. [...]
thesis.creator: Jacobsen, Eric Rivers.
thesis.subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.
thesis.title: Kane system of composite construction.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
